page.title: 07RIDING FOR THE DISABLED
page.content:
The{Horse Riding Centre}was opened in October l984 by its Patron, HRH Princess Anne. It provides facilities for the {mentally and physically disabled}to gain confidence and enjoyment from riding. It also does research into the ways of improving riding for the disabled. The Centre has an indoor area, temporary stalls for ponies and uses several woodland trails. Further improvements will include a stable block and a reception, a lecture and office area. About 150 people ride here each week, 135 of these being disabled. The other riders come mainly from pupils in the two local comprehensive schools who take a{CSE Handmasters course.
